TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
> 
> I do like how much science it is worth though.

Apparently using a kerbal as a guinea pig is much better than using the materials bay. Who would have known?

> 
> Apparently using a kerbal as a guinea pig is much better than using the materials bay. Who would have known?

The base image was from a barometer scan--I thought it appropriate. Love that Eve surface multiplier!

> Alouette-- Abandoned

Poor, poor Alouette, all alone in the night (cue Babylon 5 music)

Also, how did Bob take a breathalizer given to him by Jeb on Eve?
I'm sure that the suit has a air composition tester to make sure no dangerous gases enter the air supply, a little (probably default--knowing kerbfleet) could convert it to a breathalyzer
Wonderful stuff. What, though, was the one thing they forgot in the previous page?

Bill finally gets a chance to show off his 'piloting' skills.

He's probably the best choice. He tends to be a bit more cautious than some of the others. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

And, of course, he hasn't been into the 'hydrazine'.

Looking forward to the musical interlude.

Happy landings!

> 
> Wonderful stuff. What, though, was the one thing they forgot in the previous page?

That they were supposed to be guiding the M7 to its landing spot.

What happened to allouete? o\_O

i forgot ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

> 
> What happened to allouete? o\_O
> i forgot ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

Around Gilly, I think.

> Yes it is I'm afraid, I already have a song picked out by another... Artist.

Hum, maybe they will get some *purple rain* in the way ? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> That they were supposed to be guiding the M7 to its landing spot.

Ah, thank you

> 
> Hum, maybe they will get some *purple rain* in the way ? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

![h46340EE3](https://i.chzbgr.com/maxW500/6881867520/h46340EE3/)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-17T21:25:20Z" title="10/17/2015 09:25  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 17, 2015</time> by Sanic**
  
Reasons!

> 
> I do like how much science it is worth though.

It's all part of a scientific study to see how alien planetary conditions alter the effects of 'Hydrazine' on a Kerbal. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Hum, maybe they will get some *purple rain* in the way ? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Nailed it.

![6gMgDgi.png](http://i.imgur.com/6gMgDgi.png)

![FsC9ubu.png](http://i.imgur.com/FsC9ubu.png)

![ylWO0VX.png](http://i.imgur.com/ylWO0VX.png)
Well, you can always retract the landing gear, Bill!
I have a feeling this is going to be very fun. Will some quick-saving and explosions be involved?

Now that kerbalization is hilarious!

Can't wait to see what ideas Bob and Bill come up with for docking the Billmobile.

How was the drive in the rover rocket car? 

Happy landings!
Wait... The M7 only has one cockpit...

> 
> Wait... The M7 only has one cockpit...

Nope, it has a passenger cabin too.

> 
> I have a feeling this is going to be very fun. Will some quick-saving and explosions be involved?

Always quicksaves, but you'll be pleased to know my F5 to F9 ratio was pretty favorable this time!

> 
> How was the drive in the rover rocket car?

Surprisingly easy. Slow going climbing the hills, as I had to stop to refuel every few kilometers, but not at all difficult. I had to reload just once, when I let the speed get above 40 m/s going down a steep hill...otherwise pretty uneventful. Took less than one sol to drive the full distance.

> 
> Nope, it has a passenger cabin too.

Yep: five seats in the M7, five Kerbals on the surface (Jeb, Dilsby, Bob, Bill, Tedus).
And now: 1 year of mining to refuel the M7!

So, next episode will be a series of surface docking hijinks at the tune of Yakety Sax ? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) Surface docking is one of the worst experiences in game IMHO, only surpassed by surface clawing and surface rovering with wheels ( and not landing gear ). It never seems to go right ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

That said, we *need* a animated gif of Tedus air guitar ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

![8SAsSH0.png](http://i.imgur.com/8SAsSH0.png)

![Mduz6Tn.png](http://i.imgur.com/Mduz6Tn.png)

![3TTndut.png](http://i.imgur.com/3TTndut.png)

![tpQDMTF.png](http://i.imgur.com/tpQDMTF.png)

![5AfQpyX.png](http://i.imgur.com/5AfQpyX.png)

Yeah, it wasn't fun. Careful readers will note that it actually got dark on Eve between the time I started the surface dock and when I finally finished it. I chose not to show all the work, but at one point I did have to reset the ports in the .sfs because the M7's showed "docked" not "ready". Anyway--dock accomplished, and refueling has begun!

And now **a request:** I could use a couple of custom IVA suit textures to do the last chapter of this book, when the time comes. Interested party(ies) please contact my by PM. I know what I'm looking for in the suit designs and can provide prototype artwork for you to turn into Texture Replacer-ready suit files for me. Thanks in advance!

Lol Mort tho.

Nice job getting the crafts docked!

I can't wait to see how everything turns out!

I can access this site on my school iPad, yay!

I can't read the comics though ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif).

What the universe giveith, the universe takeith away.
